@DundeeBloke @UKLabour You realise SNP MPs are likely to support a Lab gov't? If your aim really is to get Tories out, only logical choices are (1) only campaign in Tory seats in Scotland, or (2) abandon all Scotland to SNP. Opposing SNP makes no sense. Unless Tories aren't your real target, of course.

@BerthanPete @scarycath @RogueCoder250 @traquir @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP Ok. I can see both sides of this argument. But it looks to me as though you're not proposing anything different from the SNP, other than - 1. You don't want to even try for an s30, JFDI, and 2. You want to start now. Is that a fair comment?
@HOOP_hands_off 25

@BlogAlba I think she'll lose by less than is being touted. Then she'll go back to the EU to 'renegotiate'. She'll come back with some trivial concessions that make no real difference. She'll present this as a major victory, and have another vote on the subject. And she'll win that one.
@BerthanPete @scarycath @RogueCoder250 @traquir @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP So, as a series of steps, what do you propose?

@MartinHeneghan @davidallengreen That's true. I guess I should look at my statement again. I think it's sustainable if enough people want it to be - there's no technical reason it shouldn't be. But I agree that almost certainly not enough people will want it to be.

@RogueCoder250 @BerthanPete @traquir @scarycath @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP Within that clause it says "equal rights of ... peoples". If one "people" can over-rule the other but not vice versa, then there aren't equal rights.
However, Ok, it's obviously fairly subtle and might require a court actionÂ¤ to get a definitive answer.

@RogueCoder250 @BerthanPete @traquir @scarycath @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP That's interesting. However, while I agree it's couched in the language of overseas colonies, there's nothing to preclude it applying to Scotland (or Wales or NI of course).
@DaftLimmy I doubt that the Tory MPs will support that. So it'll fail. Mind you, what do I know? I thought tonight's vote would be close!
@BerthanPete @RogueCoder250 @traquir @scarycath @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP Yes, that's what I thought too.

@BerthanPete @RogueCoder250 @traquir @scarycath @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP You're not wrong. But the flip side being that international recognition will be quicker and easier if rUK don't fight it every step of the way.

@RogueCoder250 @BerthanPete @traquir @scarycath @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP Mmm. Are you sure? E.g., several French colonies around the world are 'part of France' with representation in parliament. I can't believe the UN principle would exclude them.
@BerthanPete @RogueCoder250 @traquir @scarycath @Gillian_Emm @WingsScotland @theSNP Fair point. Expediency, I think.
